WndProperty.Name: prpUserLevel
WndProperty.Help: Sets the level of detail of the configuration settings. [Basic]: Only basic settings are shown. [Expert]: Basic and advanced settings are shown.

WndProperty.Name: prpMapFile
WndProperty.Caption: Map file
WndProperty.Help: The name of the file containing terrain, topology, and optionally waypoints, airfield details and airspace.

WndProperty.Name: prpWaypointFile
WndProperty.Caption: Waypoints 1
WndProperty.Help: Primary waypoints file. File must be in Cambridge format (.dat extension).

WndProperty.Name: prpAdditionalWaypointFile
WndProperty.Caption: Waypoints 2
WndProperty.Help: Secondary waypoints file. This may be used to add waypoints for a competition. File must be in Cambridge format (.dat extension).

WndProperty.Name: prpAirspaceFile
WndProperty.Caption: Airspace 1
WndProperty.Help: The file name of the primary airspace file.

WndProperty.Name: prpAdditionalAirspaceFile
WndProperty.Caption: Airspace 2
WndProperty.Help: The file name of the secondary airspace file.

WndProperty.Name: prpTerrainFile
WndProperty.Caption: Terrain file*
WndProperty.Help: The name of the file containing digital elevation terrain data.

WndProperty.Name: prpTopologyFile
WndProperty.Caption: Topology file*
WndProperty.Help: Specifies the file defining the topological features.

WndProperty.Name: prpAirfieldFile
WndProperty.Caption: Airfields file*
WndProperty.Help: The airfields file may contain extracts from Enroute Supplements or other contributed information about individual airfields.

WndProperty.Name: prpWaypointsOutOfRange
WndProperty.Caption: Wpt outside terrain*
WndProperty.Help: This option defines how waypoints outside the terrain range are handled: the user can be asked when this occurs, or they can be always included or excluded.

WndProperty.Name: prpAirspaceDisplay
WndProperty.Caption: Airspace display
WndProperty.Help: Controls filtering of airspace for display and warnings. The airspace filter button also allows filtering of display and warnings independently for each airspace class. [All on] All is displayed. [Clip] Only airspace below the clip altitude. [Auto] All within a margin of the glider. [All below] All airspace below the glider.

WndProperty.Name: prpClipAltitude
WndProperty.Caption: Clip altitude
WndProperty.Help: For clip airspace mode, this is the altitude below which airspace is displayed.

WndProperty.Name: prpAltWarningMargin
WndProperty.Caption: Margin
WndProperty.Help: For auto airspace mode, this is the altitude above/below which airspace is included.

WndProperty.Name: prpAirspaceWarnings
WndProperty.Caption: Warnings
WndProperty.Help: Enable/disable all airspace warnings.

WndProperty.Name: prpWarningTime
WndProperty.Caption: Warning time*
WndProperty.Help: This is the time before an airspace incursion is estimated at which the system will warn the pilot.

WndProperty.Name: prpAcknowledgementTime
WndProperty.Caption: Acknowledge time*
WndProperty.Help: This is the time period in which an acknowledged airspace warning will not be repeated.

WndProperty.Name: prpAirspaceOutline
WndProperty.Caption: Use black outline*
WndProperty.Help: Draw a black outline around each airspace rather than the airspace color

WndProperty.Name: prpEnableTerrain
WndProperty.Caption: Terrain display
WndProperty.Help: Draws digital elevation terrain on the map. This is shaded by the wind direction: upwind is brighter, downwind darker.

WndProperty.Name: prpEnableTopology
WndProperty.Caption: Topology display
WndProperty.Help: Draw topological features (roads, rivers, lakes etc) on the map. Requires the topology file to be specified.

WndProperty.Name: prpTerrainContrast
WndProperty.Caption: Terrain contrast
WndProperty.Help: Defines the amount of phong shading in the terrain rendering. Use large values to emphasise terrain slope, smaller values if flying in steep mountains.

WndProperty.Name: prpTerrainBrightness
WndProperty.Caption: Terrain brightness
WndProperty.Help: Defines the brightness (whiteness) of the terrain rendering. This controls the average illumination of the terrain.

WndProperty.Name: prpTerrainRamp
WndProperty.Caption: Terrain colors
WndProperty.Help: Defines the color ramp used in terrain rendering.

WndProperty.Name: prpWaypointLabels
WndProperty.Caption: Labels
WndProperty.Help: Determines how labels are displayed with each waypoint: [Names] The full name of each waypoint is displayed. [Numbers] The waypoint number of each waypoint is displayed. [None] No names are displayed with the waypoints. [Names in task] Names are only displayed for waypoints that are in the active task as well as the home airfield. [First Three] The first 3 letters of the waypoint name are displayed. [First Five] The first 5 letters of the waypoint name are displayed.

WndProperty.Name: prpTrail
WndProperty.Caption: Trail length
WndProperty.Help: Determines whether and how long a snail trail is drawn behind the glider

WndProperty.Name: prpOrientation
WndProperty.Caption: Orientation
WndProperty.Help: Determines how the screen is rotated with the glider: [North up] The moving map display will always be orientated north to south and the glider icon will be rotated to show its course. [Track up] The moving map display will be rotated so the glider's track is oriented up. [North up when circling] Track-up in cruise and north-up when circling. [Target up when circling] Track-up in cruise and the bearing to next waypoint up when circling. [North/track] North-up in cruise, glider track-track up in circling

WndProperty.Name: prpAutoZoom
WndProperty.Caption: Auto zoom
WndProperty.Help: Auto-zoom changes the zoom level during flight so that the map zooms in as the active waypoint is approached. After passing a waypoint, the map zooms out to the next waypoint.

WndProperty.Name: prpCirclingZoom
WndProperty.Caption: Circling zoom
WndProperty.Help: If enabled, then the map will zoom in automatically when entering circling mode and zoom out automatically when leaving circling mode.

WndProperty.Name: prpTrailDrift
WndProperty.Caption: Trail drift*
WndProperty.Help: Determines whether the snail trail is drifted with the wind when displayed in circling mode.

WndProperty.Name: prpSnailWidthScale
WndProperty.Caption: Trail width*
WndProperty.Help: Sets the width of the snail trail display.

WndProperty.Name: prpWindArrowStyle
WndProperty.Caption: Wind arrow*
WndProperty.Help: Determines the way the wind arrow is drawn on the map. [Arrow head] Draws an arrow head only [Full arrow] Draws an arrow head with a dashed arrow line

WndProperty.Name: prpSafetyAltitudeArrival
WndProperty.Caption: Arrival height
WndProperty.Help: The height above terrain that the glider should arrive at for a safe landing.

WndProperty.Name: prpSafetyAltitudeBreakoff
WndProperty.Caption: Breakoff height
WndProperty.Help: This is the height above terrain, below which the pilot should abort the task and prepare for an outlanding.

WndProperty.Name: prpSafetyAltitudeTerrain
WndProperty.Caption: Terrain height
WndProperty.Help: The height above terrain that the glider must clear during final glide.

WndProperty.Name: prpAbortSafetyUseCurrent
WndProperty.Caption: Abort use current Mc*
WndProperty.Help: When enabled, the current MacCready setting is used for determining arrival altitude during task abort mode.

WndProperty.Name: prpSafetyMacCready
WndProperty.Caption: Safety Mc*
WndProperty.Help: The MacCready setting used in task abort mode and for determining arrival altitude at airfields.

WndProperty.Name: prpFinalGlideTerrain
WndProperty.Caption: Glide terrain line
WndProperty.Help: This determines whether the the glide terrain range is calculated and drawn as a line on the map area: [OFF] Disables display [Line] Draws a dashed line at the glide range [Shade] Shades terrain outside glide range

WndProperty.Name: prpAutoWind
WndProperty.Caption: Auto wind
WndProperty.Help: This allows switching on or off the automatic wind algorithm. When the algorithm is switched off, the pilot is responsible for setting the wind estimate. [Circling] Requires only a GPS source [ZigZag] requires an intelligent vario with airspeed output. [Both] Use ZigZag and circling.

WndProperty.Name: prpAutoMcMode
WndProperty.Caption: Auto Mc mode
WndProperty.Help: This option defines which auto MacCready algorithm is used. [Final glide] adjusts Mc for fastest arrival. For OLC sprint tasks, the MacCready is adjusted in order to cover the greatest distance in the remaining time and reach the finish height. [Average] sets Mc to the average climb rate across all climbs. [Both] Uses average during task, then fastest arrival when in final glide mode.

WndProperty.Name: prpThermalLocator
WndProperty.Caption: Lift center
WndProperty.Help: The estimate of the center of lift is displayed when in circling mode. [OFF] Lift center locator disabled. [Circle at center] A thermal marker is displayed at the center of lift. [Pan to center] A marker is displayed at the center of lift, and when circling, the display is panned to this lift center.

WndProperty.Name: prpBlockSTF
WndProperty.Caption: Block speed to fly*
WndProperty.Help: If enabled, the command speed in cruise is set to the MacCready speed to fly in no vertical air-mass movement. If disabled, the command speed in cruise is set to the dolphin speed to fly, equivalent to the MacCready speed with vertical air-mass movement.

WndProperty.Name: prpAutoForceFinalGlide
WndProperty.Caption: Auto Force Final Glide*
WndProperty.Help: This option enables automatic forcing of final glide mode if the aircraft is above final glide prior to reaching the penultimate waypoint. Forcing final glide early can also be performed manually from the task menu.

WndProperty.Name: prpEnableNavBaroAltitude
WndProperty.Caption: Nav by baro altitude*
WndProperty.Help: When enabled and if connected to a barometric altimeter, barometric altitude is used for all navigation functions. Otherwise GPS altitude is used.

WndProperty.Name: prpEnableExternalTriggerCruise
WndProperty.Caption: Flap forces cruise*
WndProperty.Help: When Vega variometer is connected and this option is true, the positive flap setting switches the flight mode between circling and cruise.

WndProperty.Name: prpRiskGamma
WndProperty.Caption: STF risk factor*
WndProperty.Help: The STF risk factor reduces the MacCready setting used to calculate speed to fly as the glider gets low, in order to compensate for risk. Set to 0.0 for no compensation, 1.0 scales Mc linearly with height.

WndProperty.Name: prpPolarType
WndProperty.Caption: Type
WndProperty.Help: This contains a selection of gliders of different performance classes, as well as a special entry for WinPilot File.

WndProperty.Name: prpPolarFile
WndProperty.Caption: Polar file
WndProperty.Help: When WinPilot File is the polar type, this is the name of the file containing the glide polar data.

WndProperty.Name: prpMaxManoeuveringSpeed
WndProperty.Caption: V rough air
WndProperty.Help: The maximum manoeuvring speed can be entered on this page to prevent the glide computer from commanding unrealistic cruise speeds.

WndProperty.Name: prpHandicap
WndProperty.Caption: Handicap
WndProperty.Help: The handicap factor used for OnLine Contest scoring.

WndProperty.Name: prpDisableAutoLogger
WndProperty.Caption: Auto logger*
WndProperty.Help: Enables the automatic starting and stopping of logger on takeoff and landing respectively. Disable when flying paragliders.

WndProperty.Name: prpBallastSecsToEmpty
WndProperty.Caption: Dump time
WndProperty.Help: The time in seconds to dump full ballast.

WndProperty.Name: prpComDevice1
WndProperty.Caption: Name
WndProperty.Help: Type of primary device. The primary device should be the most reliable GPS data source.

WndProperty.Name: prpComPort1
WndProperty.Caption: Port
WndProperty.Help: Altair Pro users should set this to Port 3

WndProperty.Name: prpComSpeed1
WndProperty.Caption: Baudrate
WndProperty.Help: Altair Pro or Vega users should set this to 38400.

WndProperty.Name: prpComDevice2
WndProperty.Caption: Name
WndProperty.Help: Type of secondary device. The secondary device may be used as backup GPS data or other data e.g. from an intelligent variometer. Generic can be used for GPS sources including FLARM.

WndProperty.Name: prpComPort2
WndProperty.Caption: Port
WndProperty.Help: Altair Pro users should set this to Port 1.

WndProperty.Name: prpComSpeed2
WndProperty.Caption: Baudrate
WndProperty.Help: Altair Pro or Vega users should set this to 38400.

WndProperty.Name: prpSetSystemTimeFromGPS
WndProperty.Caption: Use GPS time
WndProperty.Help: option, if enabled sets the clock of the computer to the GPS time once a fix is set. This is only necessary if your computer does not have a real-time clock with battery backup or your computer frequently runs out of battery power or otherwise loses time.

WndProperty.Name: prpStartMaxSpeed
WndProperty.Caption: Start max speed
WndProperty.Help: Maximum speed allowed in start observation zone. Set to 0 for no limit.

WndProperty.Name: prpStartMaxSpeedMargin
WndProperty.Caption: Start max speed margin
WndProperty.Help: Maximum speed to above maximum start speed to tolerate. Set to 0 for no tolerance.

WndProperty.Name: prpStartMaxHeight
WndProperty.Caption: Start max height
WndProperty.Help: Maximum height above ground while starting the task. Set to 0 for no limit.

WndProperty.Name: prpStartMaxHeightMargin
WndProperty.Caption: Start max height margin
WndProperty.Help: Maximum height above maximum start height to tolerate. Set to 0 for no tolerance.

WndProperty.Name: prpStartHeightRef
WndProperty.Caption: Start height ref
WndProperty.Help: Reference used for start max height rule [MSL] Reference is altitude above mean sea level [AGL] Reference is the height above the start point

WndProperty.Name: prpFinishMinHeight
WndProperty.Caption: Finish min height
WndProperty.Help: Minimum height above ground while finishing the task. Set to 0 for no limit.

WndProperty.Name: prpFAIFinishHeight
WndProperty.Caption: FAI finish height
WndProperty.Help: If enabled, this option requires the minimum height above ground for finish to be greater than 1000m below the start height.

WndProperty.Name: prpOLCRules
WndProperty.Caption: Online contest
WndProperty.Help: Rules used for calculating optimal points for OnLine Contest. [Sprint]: Conforms to FAI IGC League rules. Up to 5 points including start and finish, maximum duration 2.5 hours, finish height must not be below start height. [Triangle]: Conforms to FAI OLC triangle rules. Four points with common start and finish. For tasks longer than 500km, no leg less than 25% or larger than 45%; otherwise no leg less than 28% of total. Finish height must not be lower than start height less 1000 meters. [Classic]: Conforms to OLC classic rules. Up to seven points including start and finish, finish height must not be lower than start height less 1000 meters. Points awarded 80% on second last leg and 60% on last leg.

WndProperty.Name: prpUnitsSpeed
WndProperty.Caption: Aircraft/wind speed
WndProperty.Help: Units used for airspeed and ground speed. A separate unit is available for task speeds.

WndProperty.Name: prpUnitsDistance
WndProperty.Caption: Distance
WndProperty.Help: Units used for horizontal distances e.g. range to waypoint, distance to go.

WndProperty.Name: prpUnitsLift
WndProperty.Caption: Lift
WndProperty.Help: Units used for vertical speeds (variometer)

WndProperty.Name: prpUnitsAltitude
WndProperty.Caption: Altitude
WndProperty.Help: Units used for altitude and heights.

WndProperty.Name: prpUnitsTaskSpeed
WndProperty.Caption: Task Speed
WndProperty.Help: Units used for task speeds.

WndProperty.Name: prpUnitsLatLon
WndProperty.Caption: Lat/Lon
WndProperty.Help: Units used for latitude and longitude.

WndProperty.Name: prpUTCOffset
WndProperty.Caption: UTC Offset
WndProperty.Help: The UTC offset field allows the UTC local time offset to be specified. The local time is displayed below in order to make it easier to verify the correct offset has been entered.

WndProperty.Name: prpAutoBlank
WndProperty.Caption: Auto Blank
WndProperty.Help: This determines whether to blank the display after a long period of inactivity when operating on internal battery power.

WndProperty.Name: prpLockSettingsInFlight
WndProperty.Caption: Safety lock
WndProperty.Help: This determines whether the configuration settings dialog is accessible during flight.

WndProperty.Name: prpAppStatusMessageAlignment
WndProperty.Caption: Msg window*
WndProperty.Help: Defines the alignment of the status message box, either centered or in the top left corner.

WndProperty.Name: prpInputFile
WndProperty.Caption: Events*
WndProperty.Help: The Input Events file defines the menu system and how XCSoar responds to button presses and events from external devices.

WndProperty.Name: prpLanguageFile
WndProperty.Caption: Language*
WndProperty.Help: The language file defines translations for XCSoar text in English to other languages. If this field is left blank, then XCSoar uses English.

WndProperty.Name: prpStatusFile
WndProperty.Caption: Status message*
WndProperty.Help: The status file can be used to define sounds to be played when certain events occur, and how long various status messages will appear on screen.

WndProperty.Name: prpMenuTimeout
WndProperty.Caption: Menu timeout*
WndProperty.Help: This determines how long menus will appear on screen if the user does not make any button presses or interacts with the computer.

WndProperty.Name: prpDebounceTimeout
WndProperty.Caption: Debounce time*
WndProperty.Help: This is the minimum interval between the system recognising key presses. Set this to a low value for a more responsive user interface; if it is too low, then accidental multiple key presses can occur.

WndProperty.Name: prpAnimation
WndProperty.Caption: Animation*
WndProperty.Help: Determines whether to draw window animations when dialogs open/close.

WndProperty.Name: prpTextInput
WndProperty.Caption: Text Input Style*
WndProperty.Help: Determines how the user is prompted for text input (filename, teamcode etc.)

WndProperty.Name: prpGliderScreenPosition
WndProperty.Caption: Glider position
WndProperty.Help: Defines the location of the glider drawn on the screen in percent from the bottom.

WndProperty.Name: prpAppIndLandable
WndProperty.Caption: Landable fields
WndProperty.Help: Two styles are available: WinPilot style (green and purple circles) or a high visibility (monochrome) style.

WndProperty.Name: prpAppCompassAppearance
WndProperty.Caption: North arrow*
WndProperty.Help: Two styles are available. Normal, or with a white outline.

WndProperty.Name: prpAppInverseInfoBox
WndProperty.Caption: Inverse infoboxes*
WndProperty.Help: If true, the InfoBoxes are white on black, otherwise black on white.

WndProperty.Name: prpAppInfoBoxColors
WndProperty.Caption: Color infoboxes*
WndProperty.Help: If true, certain InfoBoxes will have coloured text. For example, the active waypoint infobox will be blue when the glider is above final glide.

WndProperty.Name: prpAppInfoBoxBorder
WndProperty.Caption: Infobox border*
WndProperty.Help: Two styles for infobox borders are available: [Box] Draws boxes around each infobox. [Tab] Draws a tab at the top of the infobox across the title.

WndProperty.Name: prpAppInfoBoxGeom
WndProperty.Caption: Infobox Geometry
WndProperty.Help: Geometry values range 0-7 but in landscape mode only some of them are really available.

WndProperty.Name: prpUseCustomFonts
WndProperty.Caption: Customize Fonts
WndProperty.Help: Defines the location of the glider drawn on the screen in percent from the bottom.

WndProperty.Name: prpAppGaugeVarioSpeedToFly
WndProperty.Caption: Speed arrows
WndProperty.Help: Whether to show speed command arrows on the Vario gauge. When shown, in cruise mode, arrows point up to command slow down; arrows point down to command speed up.

WndProperty.Name: prpAppGaugeVarioAvgText
WndProperty.Caption: Show average
WndProperty.Help: Whether to show the average climb rate. In cruise mode, this switches to showing the average netto airmass rate.

WndProperty.Name: prpAppGaugeVarioMc
WndProperty.Caption: Show MacReady
WndProperty.Help: Whether to show the MacCready setting.

WndProperty.Name: prpAppGaugeVarioBugs
WndProperty.Caption: Show bugs*
WndProperty.Help: Whether to show the bugs percentage.

WndProperty.Name: prpAppGaugeVarioBallast
WndProperty.Caption: Show ballast*
WndProperty.Help: Whether to show the ballast percentage.

WndProperty.Name: prpAppGaugeVarioGross
WndProperty.Caption: Show gross*
WndProperty.Help: Whether to show the gross climb rate.

WndProperty.Name: prpAppAveNeedle
WndProperty.Caption: Averager needle*
WndProperty.Help: If true, the vario gauge will display a hollow averager needle. During cruise, this needle displays the average netto value. During circling, this needle displays the average gross value.

WndProperty.Name: prpEnableFLARMMap
WndProperty.Caption: FLARM map
WndProperty.Help: This enables the display of FLARM traffic on the map window [OFF] FLARM map display disabled [ON/Fixed] FLARM map display enabled with fixed scale. [ON/Scaled] FLARM map display enabled and auto scaled. When auto scaling is enabled, the FLARM targets on the map display are scaled so that when the map is at large zoom levels, targets are still visible.

WndProperty.Name: prpEnableFLARMGauge
WndProperty.Caption: FLARM radar
WndProperty.Help: This enables the display of the FLARM radar gauge. The track bearing of the target relative to the track bearing of the aircraft is displayed as an arrow head, and a triangle pointing up or down shows the relative altitude of the target relative to you. In all modes, the color of the target indicates the threat level.

WndProperty.Name: prpAutoAdvance
WndProperty.Caption: Auto advance
WndProperty.Help: Determines how waypoints are advanced through the task. [Manual] Fully manual task waypoint advancing [Auto] Fully automatic task waypoint advancing [Arm] Automatic task waypoint advancing needs to be armed each waypoint [Arm start] Automatic task waypoint advancing needs to be armed for the start

WndProperty.Name: prpTaskStartLine
WndProperty.Caption: Start type
WndProperty.Help: Type of the start. [Line]: The task is started when the line is crossed. The line length is set via the 'Start radius' property. [Cylinder]: The task is started when the glider leaves the cylinder. The cylinder radius is set via the 'Start radius' property. [FAI Sector]: Defines a 90 degree sector. The task is started when the glider crosses the sector lines. The radius of the sector is set via the 'Start radius' property.

WndProperty.Name: prpTaskStartRadius
WndProperty.Caption: Start radius
WndProperty.Help: Radius of the start cylinder/sector or half-length of the start line.

WndProperty.Name: prpTaskFAISector
WndProperty.Caption: Sector type
WndProperty.Help: Type of sectors used for non-AAT tasks. [Cylinder] Barrel cylinder of specified radius. [FAI sector] 90 degree sector centered at bisector at specified radius [DAe 0.5/10] German national sector type, equivalent to 0.5 km radius barrel and 10 km FAI sector.

WndProperty.Name: prpTaskSectorRadius
WndProperty.Caption: Sector radius
WndProperty.Help: Radius of the turnpoint observation area for non-AAT tasks.

WndProperty.Name: prpTaskFinishLine
WndProperty.Caption: Finish type
WndProperty.Help: Type of the finish. [Line]: The task is finished when the line is crossed. The line length is set via the 'Finish radius' property. [Cylinder]: The task is finished when the glider enters the cylinder. The cylinder radius is set via the 'Finish radius' property. [FAI Sector]: Defines a 90 degree sector. The task is finished when the glider crosses the sector lines. The radius of the sector is set via the 'Finish radius' property.

WndProperty.Name: prpTaskFinishRadius
WndProperty.Caption: Finish radius
WndProperty.Help: Radius of the finish cylinder or half length of the finish line.

WndProperty.Name: prpLoggerTimeStepCruise
WndProperty.Caption: Time step cruise*
WndProperty.Help: This is the time interval between logged points when not circling.

WndProperty.Name: prpLoggerTimeStepCircling
WndProperty.Caption: Time step circling*
WndProperty.Help: This is the time interval between logged points when circling.

WndProperty.Name: prpLoggerShortName
WndProperty.Caption: Short file name
WndProperty.Help: This determines whether the logger uses the short IGC file name or the long IGC file name. Example short name (81HXABC1.IGC), long name (2008-01-18-XXX-ABC-01.IGC).

WndProperty.Name: prpAppInfoBoxModel
WndProperty.Caption: Device model
WndProperty.Help: Choose your model.
